summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, regarding a request by the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to tour the Special Housing Unit (SHU), suicide watch areas, and Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The visit was scheduled for August 15, 2019, following Epstein's death, and the prosecutors requested to be escorted only by MCC legal staff and not to speak to guards due to ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: The US Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is requesting a tour of the MCC facilities, including Epstein's cell, for himself and his staff.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The recipient of the initial email, being informed of the US Attorney's request to tour the SHU and suicide watch areas at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC
persons.context: The sender of the forwarding email to the Warden, relaying the US Attorney's tour request and attempting to arrange it for 10 am on August 15.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose cell is requested to be viewed by the US Attorney's Office; it is noted as still being cordoned off.

connections.description: Berman, as US Attorney, is making an official request to the Warden of the MCC for a facility tour.
The Supervisory Staff Attorney is the intermediary forwarding Berman's tour request to the Warden.
Berman's office is investigating the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death, hence the request to see his cordoned-off cell.

events.description: The US Attorney's Office for the SDNY schedules a tour of the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation/suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Jeffrey Epstein's cell.

events.title: Email Request for MCC Tour
events.description: An email is sent forwarding a request from US Attorney Geoffrey Berman to tour specific areas of the MCC related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, led by Geoffrey Berman, requested a tour of the MCC's suicide watch and SHU areas, as well as Epstein's cell, on August 15, 2019.
The request specifies that only MCC legal staff should escort the prosecutors and that they will not speak to any guards present, citing ongoing investigations.
Epstein's cell was noted as still being cordoned off at the time of the request, indicating it was preserved as part of the death investigation.
The email highlights the immediate investigative steps taken by federal prosecutors following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
